name: Request Deadline Adjustment
description: Remote data entry worker is given a large task with an unrealistic one-day deadline and needs to ask for a more realistic timeline.
student_task: You are a remote data entry worker. Your project coordinator Lena Brooks has asked you to enter a very large amount of data by tomorrow, but you know it is not realistic to finish everything with good quality. Reply to Lena's email. Be respectful, explain in simple English how much you can realistically finish, suggest a more realistic timeline, and offer any ideas to help, such as priorities or partial delivery. Show that you care about quality and want to meet expectations.
counterpart_style: You are a project coordinator who is under time pressure but open to feedback. You appreciate honest estimates and concrete suggestions.
counterpart_context: You assigned your data entry worker a large data entry task with a deadline of end of day tomorrow.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student stays polite, clearly explains the problem with the deadline, gives a realistic plan, and suggests options instead of just saying 'no'.
starter_email_body:
Hi {student_name},

We just got a batch of 450 customer records that need to be entered into the system. The client is expecting the updated database by end of day tomorrow, so I need all of these completed by then.

The spreadsheet is in the shared drive under "Incoming Data > March Batch." Each record has about 15 fields. Please follow the standard formatting guidelines.

Let me know once you get started.

Thanks,
Lena
starter_email_generation_hint: Write a short email from the project coordinator assigning a large data entry task and asking for it to be completed by tomorrow, without asking if the timeline is realistic.
